alert.note: Alert for Bath; Elliott; Fleming; Montgomery; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 7:50AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Montgomery, Bath, Fleming, Rowan and northwestern Elliott Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 749 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gesling to 7 miles north of Waltz to Poplar Plains to Cowan to 7 miles northeast of Cynthiana. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fairview, Poplar Plains, Cowan, Tilton, Pecks Ridge, Elizaville and Craintown around 755 AM EDT. Hillsboro and Sherburne around 800 AM EDT. Ringos Mills around 805 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Oakley, Wyoming, Grange City, Cranston, Pebble, Bethel, Plummers Landing, Sharpsburg, Odessa, Hays Crossing, Munson, Morehead, Slate Valley, Hilda, Craigs, Peasticks, Sharkey, Reynoldsville, Polksville, Rodburn, Owingsville, Marshall, Stoops, Clearfield, Mount Sterling, Salt Lick, Bourbon Furnace, Kendall Springs, Farmers, Freestone, Bluestone, Preston, Ramey and Judy. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 148. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
